origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Western Connecticut State University. Division of Student Affairs

did.abstract: The Division of Student Affairs is responsible for oversight of university functions affecting student life and for setting and enforcing related policies. The division's records consist of administrative information, committee files, annual reports, and budgetary records as well as files pertaining to student organizations. The records of the Division of Student Affairs span the dates 1926'-2006, and are organized into seven series: (1) Athletics/Recreation, (2) Campus Ministries, (3) Career Development Center, (4) The Counseling Center, (5) Health Services, (6) Housing/Residential Life, (7) Student Life, and (8) Student Affairs.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the:
Ruth A. Haas Library
Archives and Special Collections
181 White Street
Danbury, CT 06810
Phone: 203-837-8992
E-mail: stevensb@wcsu.edu

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p:
Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date (if known); The Division of Student Affairs Records; RG 5; box number; folder number; Western Connecticut State University Archives

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The Division of Student Affairs is responsible for oversight of university functions affecting student life and for setting and enforcing related policies. The division's records consist of administrative information, committee files, annual reports, and budgetary records as well as files pertaining to student organizations.
The Greek Council is the governing body for all Western Connecticut State University social fraternities and sororities.

The Forum Club was founded in 1928 by Dr. K. Augusta Sutton, Professor of History and Government. The club provided an opportunity for those interested in public affairs to study and discuss them more fully than in a class situation. The club was affiliated with the International Relations Clubs program of the Carnegie Endowment Association for International Peace.

The Student Government Association (SGA), formerly known as the Student Cooperative Government Association and Cooperative Government Association (CGA), was established in 1928 by Lothrop Higgins, the second president of DNS. The SGA is the sole governing body of the student organizations at WCSU. Its purpose is to coordinate all campus organizations, and to promote and protect the interests, education and welfare of students. See also Record Group 7, Student Organizations: Student Government Association.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The records of the Division of Student Affairs span the dates 1926-2006, and are organized into seven series: (1) Athletics/Recreation, (2) Campus Ministries, (3) Career Development Center, (4) The Counseling Center, (5) Health Services, (6) Housing/Residential Life, (7) Student Life, and (8) Student Affairs.

The Greek Council materials in Series 7 contain minutes of meetings, treasurer's reports, annual reports, and the original petition for establishing a chapter of Kappa Delta Pi, Epsilon XI Chapter, at Danbury State Teachers College. A scrapbook created by Kappa Delta Pi containing newspaper clippings regarding their campus activities can be found in Box 3.

The Student Press Committee created the majority of the scrapbooks in this series. The scrapbooks contain newspaper clippings from Danbury and regional newspapers, which contain news items related to or involving the school's faculty, staff, students, and alumni. In addition, Lilly George created a scrapbook of memorabilia collected during a student trip to Washington, D. C. in February 1952.

This series also contains information regarding The Forum Club. The Forum Club scrapbook contains a collection of memorabilia such as membership lists, invitations, programs, and newspaper articles concerning the club and its annual dinner and guest speaker.
Series 1 Athletics/Recreation, 1950-1999 (w/gaps); Box 1; Arranged in chronological order.; Booklets, sports schedules, and information pamphlets.;
Series 2 Campus Ministries, 1954-2001 (w/gaps); Box 1; Arranged in chronological order.; Pamphlets and flyers.;
Series 3 Career Development Center, 1972-2000; Boxes 1, 6, and Oversized 2; Arranged in alphabetical and chronological order.; Annual Reports, newsletters, and poster.;
Series 4 The Counseling Center, 1988-1999 (w/gaps); Box 1; Arranged in alphabetical order.; Correspondence, newsletters, and reports.;
Series 5 Health Services, 1978-2001 (w/gaps); Box 1; Arranged in chronological order.; Correspondence and pamphlets.;

Series 6 Housing/Residential Life, 1941-1962 (w/gaps); Box 1 and Oversized 2; Arranged in alphabetical and chronological order.; Duty books, housekeeping inventories, minutes, receipts and disbursements, dorm songs, and housing regulations.

Series 7 Student Life, 1926-2006 (w/gaps); Boxes 2-6, 18, and Oversized 1-2; Arranged in alphabetical and chronological order.Bulletins, handbooks, flyers, manuals, minutes, programs, publications, and scrapbooks.

Series 8 Student Affairs, 1926-2003 (w/gaps); Boxes 7-18, and Oversized 2; Arranged in alphabetical and chronological order.Annual reports, audits, bulletins, journals, handbooks, manuals, policies and procedures, programs and services, publications, and videotapes.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Folders are arranged alphabetically in each series.
The files are grouped into 8 series:

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: Some photographs and publications have been removed and placed in the WCSU Miscellanea Collection and Student Publications Collection. Issues of the student newspaper, The Echo, have been removed and are filed separately under Student Publications.
